@GothKing5000 wrote:

RSCShadow:

GothKing, method226 was in the older RSCD client I took this from. Nobody using a current RSCD would have it unless they added it themselves. It is the reason why the login doesn’t look perfect.[/quote][quote=“super_, post:29, topic:355042”]that is just reducing the palette size and posterizing the render. it is exactly the same as the one he provided… you are a fucktard

excuse me? but how does trying to fix this problem, going on what someone else suggested was the root of problem make me a fucktard?
I merely tested out their suggestion and ruled it out as a possible fix to the actual underlying problem…
sigh… So don’t take this the wrong way but!
Please step onboard with the sharing of positive or at least helpful ideas or please do not reply to my posts… thank you.

item.title: [Tutorial] Jagex Login
item.dc:creator: @GothKing5000 GothKing5000
item.description:
@GothKing5000 wrote:

found method226, added it back in…
method226 function in in between
public void method221
and
public static int convertRGBToLong

public void method226(int i) {
        int j = anIntArray324[i] * anIntArray325[i];
        int ai[] = anIntArrayArray321[i];
        int ai1[] = new int[32768];
        for(int k = 0; k < j; k++) {
            int l = ai[k];
            ai1[((l & 0xf80000) >> 9) + ((l & 0xf800) >> 6) + ((l & 0xf8) >> 3)]++;
        }

        int ai2[] = new int[256];
        ai2[0] = 0xff00ff;
        int ai3[] = new int[256];
        for(int i1 = 0; i1 < 32768; i1++) {
            int j1 = ai1[i1];
            if(j1 > ai3[255]) {
                for(int k1 = 1; k1 < 256; k1++) {
                    if(j1 <= ai3[k1])
                        continue;
                    for(int i2 = 255; i2 > k1; i2--) {
                        ai2[i2] = ai2[i2 - 1];
                        ai3[i2] = ai3[i2 - 1];
                    }

                    ai2[k1] = ((i1 & 0x7c00) << 9) + ((i1 & 0x3e0) << 6) + ((i1 & 0x1f) << 3) + 0x40404;
                    ai3[k1] = j1;
                    break;
                }

            }
            ai1[i1] = -1;
        }
        byte abyte0[] = new byte[j];
        for(int l1 = 0; l1 < j; l1++) {
            int j2 = ai[l1];
            int k2 = ((j2 & 0xf80000) >> 9) + ((j2 & 0xf800) >> 6) + ((j2 & 0xf8) >> 3);
            int l2 = ai1[k2];
            if(l2 == -1) {
                int i3 = 0x3b9ac9ff;
                int j3 = j2 >> 16 & 0xff;
                int k3 = j2 >> 8 & 0xff;
                int l3 = j2 & 0xff;
                for(int i4 = 0; i4 < 256; i4++) {
                    int j4 = ai2[i4];
                    int k4 = j4 >> 16 & 0xff;
                    int l4 = j4 >> 8 & 0xff;
                    int i5 = j4 & 0xff;
                    int j5 = (j3 - k4) * (j3 - k4) + (k3 - l4) * (k3 - l4) + (l3 - i5) * (l3 - i5);
                    if(j5 < i3) {
                        i3 = j5;
                        l2 = i4;
                    }
                }

                ai1[k2] = l2;
            }
            abyte0[l1] = (byte)l2;
        }

        aByteArrayArray322[i] = abyte0;
        anIntArrayArray323[i] = ai2;
        anIntArrayArray321[i] = null;
    }

added this to function public gameimage

		//NEW METHOD226
		anIntArrayArray321 = new int[k][];
		aByteArrayArray322 = new byte[k][];
        anIntArrayArray323 = new int[k][];
		anIntArray324 = new int[k];
        anIntArray325 = new int[k];
		//NEW METHOD226

and added this in under
private int imageWidth;

	//NEW METHOD226
	public int anIntArrayArray321[][];
    public byte aByteArrayArray322[][];
    public int anIntArrayArray323[][];
    public int anIntArray324[];
    public int anIntArray325[];
	//NEW METHOD226

BUT!
my graphics are still not RSC grade… anymore suggestions or ideas?

Read full topic

item.title: [Tutorial] Jagex Login
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

[quote=“GothKing5000, post:19, topic:355042”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=451610.msg3329473#msg3329473 date=1283371637]
GothKing, method226 was in the older RSCD client I took this from. Nobody using a current RSCD would have it unless they added it themselves. It is the reason why the login doesn’t look perfect.
[/quote]
Well do you have the code for the function? I can customize it to fit inside of the current code… so that the graphics do look perfect…
I know that everyone is upgrading and customizing everything… but I just want it to look and feel just like the original… kinda like a fully restored version(mostly for privatized home use)… which i was planning on releasing code for once its done… I was even thinking about modding the server so that it was one click with NPC, Player, Event, Item, Admin, Message, and error management…

Does anyone know how to stretch the fading background image? like so… sorta going for a SNES Zelda Title screen look…[/quote]

paste the method that starts off with:

byte ? = 50;
byte ? = 50;

Read full topic
